section.title: How to add a language?
section.para: Currently, the documentation (user guide) can be generated in two languages (english and french). In order to add a language, here are the things to do:

listitem.para: Create a new directory in documentation/user_guide/xml/ named with the new language (en_US, fr_FR, de_DE, etc...); and translate all the XML files content into the new language.

Create a new file documentation/user_guide/xsl/common/<new_language>.xml copying an existing documentation/user_guide/xsl/common/<existing_language>.xml file. This file is to localize the generated text (like Table of content, Figure, etc...). Keep the key and translate all values. A lot of languages are already available in the original DocBook distribution. Just be aware of some added key for the CodeX needs (like Authors, author, Description, etc...).

Create a new file documentation/user_guide/xsl/htmlhelp/htmlhelp_<new_language>.xsl copying an existing htmlhelp_<existing_language>.xsl file. Change the line <xsl:param name="l10n.gentext.language" select="'en'"/> with the new language (the language code is the short one, the same as given to the XML file just above).

Create a new file documentation/user_guide/xsl/fo/docbook_<new_language>.xsl copying an existing fo/docbook_<existing_language>.xsl file. Change the line <xsl:param name="l10n.gentext.language" select="'en'"/> with the new language (the language code is the short one, the same as given to the XML file just above).
Edit the generate_doc.sh file and add the new language to the constant definition ALL_LANGUAGES; separated by a single space (ALL_LANGUAGES="en_US fr_FR de_DE").
